newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO eases with crude, unsold supplies.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO eases with crude, unsold supplies.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices eased on Tuesday along with crude losses and abundant supplies may pull prices even slower, traders said.
A trader said he expected bids to open around $120-$121 per tonne for 180-cst supplies loading in Singapore from November. He said offers might peak at $122 per tonne.
But a major was seen offering early November cargoes at $120 per tonne.
Traders said the market is long with enough supplies to meet demand. A trader said the European market had also shown signs of easing and this would place a lid on any price rise.
"Chinese demand is still very sporadic," said another trader.
But India has issued a tender to buy 25,000 tonnes of fuel oil for November 16-20 delivery which traders said would provide some support.
In the swaps market, November fuel oil was discussed at $120/$121, below Monday's quotes of $120.50/$121.50
